headers.subject: [YouTube-API] Re: *** Security Sandbox Violation ***
headers.received: by gxk22 with SMTP id 22so1527878gxk.9 for <google.larry.sergey@a.markmail.org>; Sun, 16 Nov 2008 12:17:30 -0800 (PST)
headers.x-http-useragent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 7.0; Windows NT 6.0; SLCC1; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; Media Center PC 5.0; .NET CLR 3.0.04506; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; eMusic DLM/4),gzip(gfe),gzip(gfe)

body.para: Thanks for reply Jeff, so this is basically expected behaviour that it shouldn't work in the authoring environment? I was just hoping it would just because of access to the output panel, etc. If you might have any ideas for workaround that would be really helpful - I'm not particularly technical other than actionscript so maybe it is just flat impossible.. One thing just to be clear is that when I've got it working locally with html + swf it's not running on a webserver just sitting in a folder on my desktop, I don't know if that changes things at all?
On Nov 14, 6:34 pm, Jeff Fisher <jfis...@youtube.com> wrote:

quote.quotepara: It looks like this error is caused by trying to use the API within Flash instead of creating the SWF and hosting it on a webserver (even one running just on localhost will do the trick). The issue has to do with the fact that since it's not running on a webserver it uses "null" as its hostname, and this causes the security violations you see.
On Wed, Nov 12, 2008 at 6:11 AM, jamesfranklin7...@googlemail.com <

Hi I'm having a problem with embedding the youtube player in flash. I'm working in flash 8. I've copied the example code from here http://code.google.com/apis/youtube/flash_api_reference.html and just changed the VIDEO_ID value to a video id. When I publish and view locally or online in a browser it works fine but in the flash authoring environment it loads the preview image but will not play the video. I also get the following errors in the output window:

*** Security Sandbox Violation *** SecurityDomain 'http://s.ytimg.com/yt/swf/cps-vfl62967.swf'tried to access incompatible context 'http://www.youtube.com/swf/l.swf?swf=http %3A//s.ytimg.com/yt/swf/cps- vfl62967.swf&video_id=PpwgYsYWwdc&rel=1&showsearch=1&eurl=http%3A//<http://www.youtube.com/swf/l.swf?swf=http%3A//s.ytimg.com/yt/swf/cps-...>

www.youtube.com/v/PpwgYsYWwdc&iurl=http%3A//i1.ytimg.com/vi/PpwgYsYWw... ' *** Security Sandbox Violation *** Connection to null halted - not permitted from http://s.ytimg.com/yt/swf/cps-vfl62967.swf -- Remote SWFs may not access local files. *** Security Sandbox Violation *** Connection to null halted - not permitted from http://s.ytimg.com/yt/swf/cps-vfl62967.swf -- Remote SWFs may not access local files.

I've tried changing the local playback security in publish settings and that makes no difference. I also tried adding youtube.com/ in the flash player security settings panel. Finally I tried these bits of code that I found in another thread but they didn't make any difference either:
Does anyone have any ideas how to fix this?
